html:
368 U.S. 402

82 S.Ct. 437

7 L.Ed.2d 394

Kenneth Lee HODGE
v.
STATE OF IOWA.

No. 149, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

January 15, 1962

Kenneth Lee Hodge, pro se.

Evan Hultman, Atty. Gen. of Iowa, for appellee.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion to dismiss is granted and the appeal is dismissed. Treating the papers whereon the appeal was taken as a petition for writ of certiorari, certiorari is denied.

2

Mr. Justice DOUGLAS is of the opinion certiorari should be granted.
html_lawbox:
368 U.S. 402 (1962)

HODGE
v.
IOWA.

No. 149, Misc.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided January 15, 1962.
APPEAL FROM THE SUPREME COURT OF IOWA.

Appellant pro se.

Evan Hultman, Attorney General of Iowa, for appellee.

PER CURIAM.

The motion to dismiss is granted and the appeal is dismissed. Treating the papers whereon the appeal was taken as a petition for writ of certiorari, certiorari is denied.

MR. JUSTICE DOUGLAS is of the opinion certiorari should be granted.
